intro: Archibaccharis taeniotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
